content: hooded cloak by dillon ekle hook m yarn lion brand homespun bulky weight yardage i am about 6 tall and used around 15 skeins for myself 2 775 yds gauge not important for this project abbreviations chain - chain chsp - chain space double_crochet - double_crochet rsc - reverse single_crochet single_crochet - single_crochet skip - skip st - stitch v-st - v_stitch double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet note the chain 2 at the beginning of each row does not count as your first double_crochet therefore the first double_crochet of each row goes in the very first stitch this also means that the final double_crochet of each row goes into the final double_crochet of the row below not into a chain body foundation chain 37 row 1 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook double_crochet in next 4 chs v-st in next chain double_crochet in next 5 chs 5 times row 2 chain 2 double_crochet in first 6 sts v-st in chsp double_crochet in next 7 sts 4 times v-st in chsp double_crochet in next 6 sts row 3 chain 2 double_crochet in first 7 sts v-st in chsp double_crochet in next 9 sts 4 times v-st in space double_crochet in next 7 sts continue to double_crochet in each double_crochet and v-st in each chsp until cloak reaches about 1 inch above wrists remember that the fabric will stretch as you make the cloak longer so you don t want to put the hand openings too low hand openings hand openings will go straight out to the sides lay cloak completely flat to find where to position the holes the holes are 10 sts wide use stitch markers to mark the sides of each hole and count the number of sts between the edge of each hole and the front hem to make sure they are evenly positioned hand opening row double_crochet in each double_crochet v-st in each chsp when you reach your first marker chain 10 skip 10 sts double_crochet in next double_crochet which should be at your next marker continue the row and repeat the process for the other hand opening when you reach your other set of markers continue the row you can remove the markers once you ve made each hand opening 1st row after hand openings double_crochet in each double_crochet v-st in each chsp at the hand openings double_crochet in each chain 2nd row after hand openings double_crochet in each double_crochet v-st in each chsp 3rd row after hand openings double_crochet in each double_crochet double_crochet twice in each chsp except the one in the back v-st in the chsp in the back continue to double_crochet in each double_crochet and v-st in the back chsp until cloak reaches desired length hood row 1 working into foundation chain join with double_crochet into first chain double_crochet in next 4 chs double_crochet twice in next chain double_crochet in next 5 chs 2 times v-st in next chain double_crochet in next 5 chs double_crochet twice in next chain 2 times double_crochet in last
